tool.name: Compare cell type annotations

configfiles.configfile: import scanpy as sc import muon as mu from sklearn.metrics import adjusted_rand_score as ari import seaborn as sns mdata = mu.read_h5mu('$rna_atac_input') ari(mdata.obs['$first_mod_annotation_name'], mdata.obs['$second_mod_annotation_name']) df_total = (mdata.obs.groupby("$second_mod_annotation_name").size().reset_index(name="n_total").set_index("$second_mod_annotation_name")) df = (mdata.obs.groupby(["$second_mod_annotation_name", "$first_mod_annotation_name"]).size().reset_index(name="n").set_index("$second_mod_annotation_name").join(df_total).reset_index()) df_frac = df.assign(frac = lambda x: x.n / x.n_total) df_wide = df_frac.set_index("$second_mod_annotation_name").pivot(columns="$first_mod_annotation_name", values="frac") heatmap_plot = sns.heatmap(df_wide, cmap="Greys") fig = heatmap_plot.get_figure() fig.savefig("rna_atac_comparison_heatmap.png")

param.name: first_mod_annotation_name
param.label: Cell type annotation name of first modality

param.name: second_mod_annotation_name
param.label: Cell type annotation name of second modality

tool.help: **What it does** This tool compares how the cell type annotations in individual modalities match each other. It first uses the adjusted Rand index to calculate a general score to compare the two modalities. Then it looks at how these cell type annotations match per cell as a wide table then visualize it with a heatmap.
